comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Evelyn Byrd Dows Bliss Gates (1912-1997) was the daughter of David Dows Jr. and Gwendolyn Burden Dows (1884-1935), of Brookville, New York (winters in Palm Beach). Her father was sheriff of Nassau County. A much later photo of her (from 1932, wearing a daring "pajama outfit"--a top and pants): news.google.com/newspapers?id=YV5QAAAAIBAJ&sjid=NA4EA... Her tombstone: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=57492175 Her first husband was Cornelius Newton Bliss III (married 1933). Her second husband was John Monteith Gates Sr. (married 1940). Her daughter Ada Gates Patton: www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20075996,00.html www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JtP8su-P0c photos.pasadenastarnews.com/2012/11/28/photos-expert-farr...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to familypedia.wikia.com/wiki/Arthur_Scott_Burden_%281879-19... Arthur Scott Burden had a daughter Eileen, born in 1910. I wonder if the photographer misheard the girl's name. Burden was a horseman; so this picture may be at a horse show.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: That's certainly a possibility, especially if the photographer asked the child her own name, or if she had a nanny with an accent. According to a society page report from 1932, Evelyn Dows was one of the bridesmaids at EILEEN Burden's wedding to Walter Maynard, scheduled for 9 February 1933. At the time of her first wedding, Eileen (1910-1970) was the daughter of Arthur Scott Burden (d. 1921) and Cynthia Roche, who was remarried as Mrs. Guy Fairfax Cary. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cynthia_Roche

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: Thanks for the information!  We will update our record.
